title: FREEZING ORDER
author: Bill Browder
description: The author of “Red Notice” tells his story of becoming Vladimir Putin’s enemy by uncovering a $230 million tax refund scheme.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: HELLO, MOLLY!
author: Molly Shannon with Sean Wilsey
description: The comedic actor shares stories of family tragedy and her years as a star of “Saturday Night Live.”

title: LEFT ON TENTH
author: Delia Ephron
description: The author and screenwriter describes losing her sister and husband to cancer, finding love again and receiving a leukemia diagnosis.

title: BITTERSWEET
author: Susan Cain
description: The author of “Quiet” suggests ways to embrace loss and suffering within ourselves and others.

title: RECESSIONAL
author: David Mamet
description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning playwright lambastes liberal politics, cancel culture and other things he finds objectionable.

title: RED NOTICE
author: Bill Browder
description: An American hedge fund manager in Russia is expelled by kleptocrats who then seize his property. Browder's investigation into the death of his attorney led to the Magnitsky Act.

title: CRYING IN H MART
author: Michelle Zauner
description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

title: STILL JUST A GEEK
author: Wil Wheaton
description: The star of “Stand by Me” and “Star Trek: The Next Generation” revisits and updates his 2004 collection of blog posts.

title: PANDORA'S JAR
author: Natalie Haynes
description: A re-examination of Greek myths and their female characters through a woman’s perspective.

title: THE STORYTELLER
author: Dave Grohl
description: A memoir by the musician known for his work with Foo Fighters and Nirvana.

title: GREENLIGHTS
author: Matthew McConaughey
description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.

title: ALL ABOUT LOVE
author: bell hooks
description: The late feminist icon explores the causes of a polarized society and the meaning of love.

title: THE 1619 PROJECT
author: edited  Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
description: Viewing America’s entanglement with slavery and its legacy, in essays adapted and expanded from The New York Times Magazine.

title: THE SPLENDID AND THE VILE
author: Erik Larson
description: An examination of the leadership of the prime minister Winston Churchill.
